@Electrical_field_2D/pot_matrix.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 % =====================================================================
00002 %> @brief pot_matrix creates matrix for potential equation using list of
00003 %> points
00004 %>
00005 %> @param discret_matrix_size    side size of matrix
00006 %> @param potential_points_idx   index use to potential computing
00007 %> @param potential_points_iidx  index to first col of pidx where boundary is set
00008 %> @param P                      map of permittivity distribution
00009 %> @param method - method of calculation of coefficients
00010 %>         'gauss' - (default) using gauss law (integral eqation)
00011 %>         'kirchhof' - calculating potential using capacitor mesh and
00012 %>          Kirchhof law
00013 %>         'finite difference' - not implemented
00014 %>
00015 %> @retval A(pixnum,pixnum) where pixnum is the number of unknown potential points
00016 % =====================================================================
00017 function A=pot_matrix(ef_obj,discret_matrix_size,potential_points_idx,potential_points_iidx,P,method)
00018 
00019 global data_type;
00020 
00021 disp 'potential matrix - creating';
00022 
00023 if nargin==5
00024     method = 'gauss';
00025 end
00026 
00027 % number of rows in potential equation matrix = 
00028 %   number of 'big' (i.e. field of view) pixels - sensor.unknowns
00029 %   + number of small pixels where potential is calculated -
00030 %   sensor.unknowns2 
00031 %   + 2*sensor.discret_matrix_size - this is required because of width of
00032 %   coefficients band
00033 
00034 band = discret_matrix_size; 
00035 
00036 pidx = potential_points_idx;
00037 vidx = potential_points_iidx + band;
00038 
00039 s2 = size(pidx,1) + ...
00040      2*band;             % diagonal band width
00041 % s2 = sensor.discret_matrix_size^2;              % full
00042 
00043 A = zeros(s2,s2,data_type);
00044 
00045                                
00046 rows = discret_matrix_size;
00047 cols = discret_matrix_size;
00048 
00049 if strcmp(method, 'gauss')==1
00050     disp 'pot_matrix - 'gauss'';
00051     for k=band+1:band+size(pidx,1)
00052 
00053         n=pidx(k-band,1);
00054         i=pidx(k-band,2);
00055         j=pidx(k-band,3);
00056 
00057         if pidx(k-band,4)==0  % calculate voltage
00058             % this may generate problem on the edge
00059             % arythmetic mean
00060             a1=P(i,j)+P(i,j-1);
00061             A(k,vidx(n-rows)) = a1;
00062             a2=P(i,j)+P(i-1,j);
00063             A(k,vidx(n-1)) = a2;
00064             a3=P(i,j)+P(i+1,j);
00065             A(k,vidx(n+1)) = a3;
00066             a4=P(i,j)+P(i,j+1);
00067             A(k,vidx(n+rows)) = a4;
00068             %A(k,k)=-(4*P(i,j)+P(i+1,j)+P(i,j+1)+P(i-1,j)+P(i,j-1));
00069             A(k,k)=-(a1+a2+a3+a4);
00070         else % boundary voltage
00071             A(k,k)=1;
00072         end
00073 
00074     %  if j==51 & i==28
00075     %      P(i,j),P(i,j-1),P(i-1,j),P(i+1,j),P(i,j+1)
00076     %      a1, a2, a3, a4, A(n,n)
00077     %  end
00078 
00079     end
00080 elseif strcmp(method,'kirchhof')==1
00081     disp 'pot_matrix - 'kirchhof'';
00082     for k=band+1:band+size(pidx,1)
00083 
00084         n=pidx(k-band,1);
00085         i=pidx(k-band,2);
00086         j=pidx(k-band,3);
00087         
00088         if pidx(k-band,4)==0  % calculate voltage
00089             % this may generate problem on the edge
00090             % capacitor mesh
00091             a1=(P(i,j)*P(i,j-1))/(P(i,j)+P(i,j-1));
00092             A(k,vidx(n-rows)) = a1;
00093             a2=(P(i,j)*P(i-1,j))/(P(i,j)+P(i-1,j));
00094             A(k,vidx(n-1)) = a2;
00095             a3=(P(i,j)*P(i+1,j))/(P(i,j)+P(i+1,j));
00096             A(k,vidx(n+1)) = a3;
00097             a4=(P(i,j)*P(i,j+1))/(P(i,j)+P(i,j+1));
00098             A(k,vidx(n+rows)) = a4;
00099             A(k,k)=-(a1+a2+a3+a4);
00100         else % boundary voltage
00101             %A(k,k)=1;
00102         end
00103 
00104     %  if j==51 & i==28
00105     %      P(i,j),P(i,j-1),P(i-1,j),P(i+1,j),P(i,j+1)
00106     %      a1, a2, a3, a4, A(n,n)
00107     %  end
00108 
00109      end
00110 else
00111     disp 'pot_matrix - Not implemented';
00112 end
00113 
00114 
00115 % zeros are not recomended on the diagonal
00116 for ii=1:size(A,1);
00117     if sum(abs(A(ii,:)))==0
00118         A(ii,ii)=1;
00119     end
00120 end
00121 
00122 % debug
00123 % n=52+(26-1)*sensor.matrix_size;
00124 % A(n,n)=1;
00125 %     h=figure(1000);
00126 % set(h,'Name','PotMatrix');
00127 % image(A*100,'cdatamapping','scaled');
00128 % set(gca,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00129 % drawnow;
00130 
00131 
00132 % draw=1;
00133 % if draw==1
00134     %h=figure(301);
00135     %set(h,'Name','Macierz równania potencja³u');
00136 
00137     %spy(A);
00138     %rank (A)
00139     %det (A)
00140 
00141     %figure(302);
00142     %plot(svd(A));
00143 %     drawnow;
00144 % end
00145 
00146 disp 'potential matrix. end.';
00147
